intro: Alsine confusa, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered with fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a waxy coating, and it thrives in sandy or disturbed soils. Alsine confusa is often found in coastal dunes, roadsides, and other arid environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
